channel.title: 32 Thoughts: The Podcast on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in 32 Thoughts: The Podcast on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: A Goaltending Roller Coaster | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description On this edition of 32 Thoughts: The Podcast Jeff and Elliotte dive into the red hot goalie trade market as a number of teams are looking to solidify between the pipes before the Christmas trade freeze. The guys talk about Jordan Kyrou and the St. Louis Blues who are feeling the new coach bump. Plus, there’s an NHL-Olympic meeting happening soon to talk about Milano Cortina 2026. Will the arena be ready in time?

item.title: Craig Berube Hit His Expiry Date | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte talk about the St. Louis Blues letting go of Head Coach Craig Berube and the reception that Jordan Kyrou received from Blues fans on Thursday. They dove into Roberto Luongo’s Ring of Honour night in Vancouver and his storied time with the Canucks. They also talked about the Minnesota Wild and Chris O’Hearn parting ways and pieced together the information they have so far. The guys touch on the new Skills Competition format for the 2024 NHL All Star Weekend, and they play with the idea of Sydney Crosby winning MVP this season.

item.title: Marek Was Right About the Flyers | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte take a look back at a violent weekend across the NHL as they key in on some nasty hits. They talk about how they expect the NHL to react and what they would do in this situation. The guys review some of the headlines from Saturday including the futures of Ethan Bear and Andrei Kuzmenko. Jeff and Elliotte talk about the unravelling Carolina Hurricanes and the surprising Philadelphia Flyers.

item.title: Sorting Through the Trade Market for Defencemen | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss Patrick Kane’s Red Wings debut before sorting through the trade market for defencemen. They dive into Calgary’s decisions when it comes to goaltending and highlight the resurgent Edmonton Oilers. Can the Oilers keep this up long enough to get back in the playoff race? Transcript

item.title: The Leafs Wanted Both Zadorov and Tanev | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss what they believe will be on the table at this week’s NHL BOG meetings in Seattle. Elliotte highlights the Toronto Maple Leafs interest in both Nikita Zadorov and Chris Tanev before Zadorov was traded to Vancouver. The guys also talk about the Oilers commitment to goaltender Jack Campbell and they dive into the extension for Sam Montembeault in Montreal. Transcript

item.title: Perry's Statement, Kane's Decision and Trade Buzz | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte react to the statement released by Corey Perry regarding the incident that led to his contract termination. They also dive into the Nikita Zadorov trade that sees the coveted defensemen land in Vancouver. They also lay out the latest details regarding Patrick Kane’s decision to sign with Detroit andJeff and Elliotte discuss the vibe around the Toronto Maple Leafs and what moves could be on the horizon.

item.title: Where are the Patrick Kane Winds Blowing? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the latest news regarding free agent forward Patrick Kane’s future as the Detroit Red Wings emerge as the new favourite to sign him. They also talk about what happened with the NHL’s handling of players who support causes such as Pride or Native American Heritage and what the NHL is worried about big picture. Jeff and Elliotte close out the podcast by talking about pro wrestler and friend of the show, CM Punk.

item.title: This Season Has Been Drama Filled | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte examine the latest surrounding the Edmonton Oilers and how the team is inclined to weather the storm. They also dive into the Columbus Blue Jackets and highlight their biggest takeaways following their win over Chicago. Elliotte provides an update on Patrick Kane’s future and the fellas get conspiratorial when discussing the Winter Classic jersey leaks. Transcript

item.title: Does Something Need to Give in Columbus? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Patrik Laine has been healthy scratched in Columbus by Pascal Vincent. Jeff and Elliotte debate whether this was the right decision to make or if it could’ve been handled differently. They also discuss the potential impact of this down season from Columbus on star prospect Adam Fantilli. The guys also provide some updates on the World Cup of Hockey and this season’s All Star Game in Toronto and Jeff tells an amazing story that will knock your socks off in this edition of the Montana’s Thought Line.

item.title: All Eyes are on Sweden | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte key in on the 2023 NHL Global Series in Sweden as the Senators and Red Wings drop the puck. They discuss the importance of international best-on-best hockey for a country like Sweden and when we might see those tournaments return. Jeff and Elliotte also talk about the struggling New York Islanders who have lost 7 straight and Elliotte provides an update on Elias Pettersson’s future with the Canucks as well as Patrick Kane’s future in the league.

item.title: The Ground Shifted Under Woodcroft | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte expand on the Edmonton Oilers relieving Jay Woodcroft of his head coaching duties and replacing him with Kris Knoblauch and Paul Coffey. Next, they discuss the latest in the Nikita Zadorov trade request reports, touch on the future of Samuel Montembeault in Montreal, and talk about Bo Horvat’s return to Vancouver this week to play his old club. They wrap the podcast by touching on this year’s Hall of Fame class.

item.title: McDavid and the Oilers Continue to Stumble | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The rough road continues for the Edmonton Oilers as they fall to the rebuilding San Jose Sharks on Thursday night. Where can this Oilers team possibly go from here? Jeff and Elliotte also add to the latest in Vancouver where former Canucks President Trevor Linden revealed details of disagreements that took place between himself and then GM Jim Benning. They also discuss the latest in Calgary where Jonathan Huberdeau was sat for an entire period.

item.title: Where Is It Hottest in Canada? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Things are tense in Edmonton, Ottawa, and Toronto. Jeff and Elliotte take the temperature of these three Canadian hockey markets. Can Edmonton correct its goaltending? Will Ottawa fire its head coach under fan pressure? Why aren’t the new guys finding success in Toronto? They also touch on the Sharks abysmal season that’s seen them lose back-to-back games where they’ve allowed 10 goals. Transcript

item.title: Michael Andlauer Doesn't Hold Back | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Following Michael Andlauer’s very open press conference on Wednesday reflecting on the punishment’s levied on his hockey club, Jeff and Elliotte give their thoughts on what was said by the Sens owner. They speak on the latest regarding neck protection in the NHL, which players are choosing to embrace the change, and finish up talking about NHL veterans in Paul Stastny and Nicklas Backstrom after both made big announcements this week.

item.title: "What Is Anyone Going to Do?" | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte recap an eventful Heritage Classic matchup between the Edmonton Oilers and Calgary Flames. Next, they dive into Joe Thornton’s retirement announcement while also touching on the fallout of the Shane Pinto suspension in Ottawa. They also take time to discuss the tragedy out of the UK where Adam Johnson passed away from an accidental skate cut during an EIHL game. Transcript

item.title: The Details of the Pinto Suspension | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte dive into the Shane Pinto suspension and unveil some more details regarding the timeline and where the league and PA might go from here when it comes to educating players about their gambling rules. They recap a bizarre Thursday night across the league and add to the report that the NHL is moving towards decentralizing its Entry Draft. Transcript

item.title: Shane Pinto Suspended | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte react and add to the news that Shane Pinto has been suspended for breaking the NHL’s gambling rules. Elliotte dives into what he’s been told and reveals how the NHL came to this conclusion. Transcript

item.title: Trouble in Northern Alberta | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss everything concerning the Edmonton Oilers as they hurtle towards the Heritage Classic against the Calgary Flames. Elliotte adds to his river cruise interview with Canucks forward Elias Pettersson and the guys talk about the Maple Leafs’ resolve in a big comeback over the weekend. Transcript

item.title: Decentralizing the NHL Draft | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman continue to discuss the NHL’s exploration into possibly decentralizing its annual Entry Draft. They also talk about the economics of the league and how the dip in attendance has impacted franchises. Transcript

item.title: Lots to Talk About | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte provide the latest developments on pride tape’s use in the NHL. They go around the league and look at the top headlines from Conor Garland in Vancouver to Devon Toews extension with the Avalanche. As always, they also answer your questions in the Montana’s Thought Line. Transcript

item.title: The Pursuit of Hockey Happiness Begins | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Regular season hockey is back! Jeff and Elliotte take a look at the biggest storylines thus far in this very young season. They key in on the attention Connor Bedard has received, the Canucks blowing out the Stanley Cup favourite Oilers, and they talk about the Leafs’ changing their goal song and the reception it received. Transcript

item.title: 32 Snapshots | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman touch on every National Hockey League franchise on the eve of the NHL’s regular season. They discuss what they believe will come of each team this upcoming year. Transcript

item.title: NHL Expansion Is on the Horizon | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman discuss what they’ve learned about Pat “Yzerman Light” Verbeek this summer, touch on NHL Expansion seemingly on the horizon, and how the NHLPA wants to leverage that. Transcript

item.title: The Worst Kept Secret in Hockey | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description This podcast is dedicated to Flames Assistant General Manager Chris Snow who passed away from ALS complications on September 30th 2023. You can donate to the Calgary Flames Foundation to directly fund ALS research and new treatments at the most progressive institutes across Canada at nhl.com/flames/fans/snowystrong. Transcript

item.title: Putting the C in Calgary | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description This episode is dedicated to the Snow family of Calgary. To donate funds to help ALS research and to find new treatments go to https://www.nhl.com/flames/fans/snowystrong Transcript

item.title: Andlauer Officially Owns the Senators | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte react to Michael Andlauer officially becoming the owner of the Ottawa Senators. They dive into some NHL young stars in the spotlight this week and react to Evgeny Kuznetsov speaking out against his former coach. The guys also interview LA Kings President Luc Robitaille and Edmonton Oilers CEO Jeff Jackson. Transcript

item.title: Turmoil in Tampa | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte get into the turmoil that has arisen in Tampa Bay between Steven Stamkos and GM Julien BriseBois. They break down the Tanner Pearson trade to Montreal and expand on what William Nylander’s possible move to center could mean for his future with the Leafs. Transcript

item.title: Babcock Resigns | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down Mike Babcock resigning as head coach of the Blue Jackets, Bedard’s rookie camp, the Senators sale, and sit down with Anders Lee and Seth Jarvis. Transcript

item.title: Babcock Decision Coming? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Mike Babcock situation and PTOs, chat with Bedard, Crosby, Draisaitl and Jack Hughes, and say goodbye to a member of their podcast team to wrap the episode. Transcript

item.title: Blue Jacket Blowup | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down the Mike Babcock player meeting situation in Columbus, chat with Johnny Gaudreau and Billy, discuss the Thomas Tatar contract and catch up with Troy Terry. Transcript

item.title: The PTO Song | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the the current state of the NHL, the latest on the ownership of the Senators, and they catch up with Filip Gustavsson and Lucas Raymond. Transcript

item.title: Colonel Sanderson | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the latest around the Jets and Connor Hellebuyck, the Senators locking in Jake Sanderson, Rasmus Dahlin rumours, and they catch up with Alexander Barkov, Pierre Engvall, Tim Stutzle and JJ Peterka. Transcript

item.title: European Voices | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Elliotte discusses some of the latest news off the top and then the guys sit down with an array of NHL players from the European Media Tour in Stockholm. Transcript

item.title: Jaywalking In Stockholm | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are in Stockholm for the NHL European Media Tour! They catch up with William Nylander and Rasmus Andersson, and get to the news of the summer — Auston Matthews signs a 4-year extension! Transcript

item.title: Dallas Green | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte welcome back award-winning musician Dallas Green to the podcast to discuss his feature with Ryan O’Reilly at Massey Hall, opening for Rage Against the Machine, his latest record, touring with Alexisonfire, and much more. Transcript

item.title: That's A Wrap | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In the season finale, Jeff and Elliotte go through all 32 teams discussing their free agency moves, what they will be looking to do ahead of next season, and things to keep an eye on throughout the off-season. Transcript

item.title: Goodbye Draft, Hello Free Agency | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte look ahead to free agency, discuss the PWHPA x PHF situation, and then Elliotte is joined by Jason Bukala to recap some of the biggest storylines from the NHL Draft. Transcript

item.title: Draft Day | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte sit down with Predators GM Barry Trotz at Bridgestone Arena to talk about the early days in Nashville and the guys go over the latest news as we gear up for the NHL Draft. Transcript

item.title: Draft Week | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description We’re in Nashville! Jeff and Elliotte kick off the podcast by discussing the latest news around the league and then preview the NHL Draft with Sam Cosentino and Jason Bukala. Transcript

item.title: Up In Flames | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Vegas Golden Knights owner, Bill Foley, joins the podcast! Jeff and Elliotte also recap the NHL Board of Governors meeting in New York, the latest on the Flames, and wonder what we’ll see from the Flyers next week. Transcript

item.title: Duck Surprise? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by former NHL general manager Chuck Fletcher as he joins Sportsnet for the NHL Draft in Nashville and they go around the league with some of the latest news. Transcript

item.title: OEL UFA | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss Vancouver buying out Oliver Ekman-Larsson, the Stanley Cup parade in Vegas, the latest on Connor Brown and Jonathan Toews, and they take your questions. Transcript

item.title: Barba$hev | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the payday Ivan Barbashev is expected to see this summer, the latest on the Leafs and Auston Matthews, Pierre-Luc Dubois generating west coast interest, and lots of intrigue around Matvei Michkov. Transcript

item.title: Knights Hit The Jackpot | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Vegas Golden Knights winning the Stanley Cup, Michael Andlauer purchasing the Ottawa Senators, and the Rangers hiring Peter Laviolette. Transcript

item.title: Cup Is In The House | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte recap a crazy finish to Game 4 in Florida, discuss the prolonged Ottawa sale process, Kyle Dubas signs a benchmark contract in Pittsburgh, teams who are eyeing Pierre-Luc Dubois, and they take your questions. Transcript

item.title: We’ve Got A Series | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte chat with Brandon Montour and Mark Stone, recap game 3 of the Stanley Cup Final, break down the Damon Severson sign and trade, and give the latest on Alex DeBrincat & Pierre-Luc Dubois. Transcript

item.title: Trade Season Starts Early | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte get into the three-team trade between the Kings-Blue Jackets-Flyers, wonder what Philly will do with Carter Hart and catch up with Bruce Cassidy and Paul Maurice in Las Vegas. Transcript

item.title: Media Day | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are in Las Vegas! They chat with Matthew Tkachuk and Alex Pietrangelo, hear from both coaches on where the Cup will be won, and the Blue Jackets hire Mike Babcock as their next head coach. Transcript

item.title: “We’re here. We’re ready to go.” | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by Ryan Smith, owner of the Utah Jazz and Real Salt Lake, to talk about his interest in owning an NHL franchise. Transcript

item.title: The Waiting Game | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte provide more details on the Kyle Dubas situation, the latest on the GM search in Toronto, discuss what’s next for the Dallas Stars, coaching hires in Washington & Nashville, and Tom Dundon comments on the future of his team. Transcript

item.title: Apsveicam! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Kyle Dubas and Pittsburgh situations, chat with NHL Senior EVP of Media and International Strategy, David Proper about the Global Series & Australia, and give Latvia credit after their bronze medal performance at the IIHF World Championship. Transcript

item.title: Stayin’ Alive | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte recap Stars-Golden Knights Game 4, credit Florida, wonder about Carolina’s off-season, discuss the Kyle Dubas agent situation, and Jeff gets his rule change! Transcript

item.title: Burning Bright | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Flames restructuring their front office and hiring Craig Conroy as GM, the Kyle Dubas statement, Ottawa sale and they take a very interesting voicemail. Transcript

item.title: Penguin Kyle? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte continue to discuss the Kyle Dubas situation, possible GM candidates in Toronto, Calgary closing in on their next GM and they break down both conference finals. Transcript

item.title: Shanahan Shocker | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Leafs not bringing back Kyle Dubas, recap the 4OT thriller between Florida-Carolina, chat with Paul Stastny, go around the league with some of the latest coaching/GM updates, and talk salary cap plus Clayton Keller. Transcript

item.title: Coyote Ugly | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the decision to reject the proposed Tempe Arena Project, recap Oilers & Leafs season-end pressers, provide coaching/GM updates, and are joined by Daniel Hilferty, Chairman & Chief Executive Officer of Comcast Spectacor. Transcript

item.title: No Canada | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte wonder what the off-season will look like for the Oilers and Leafs, give credit to the Panthers and Golden Knights, discuss the Ottawa sale, and the coaching situation in New Jersey and Columbus. Transcript

item.title: 1 Game | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte get into the Alex Pietrangelo suspension, the Hurricanes eliminating the Devils, wonder what’s next for New Jersey, discuss the sale of the Senators, a new hire in Philadelphia and some talking around the Islanders. Transcript

item.title: 11:59 For Toronto | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Leafs-Panthers series, Edmonton’s 5-on-5 play, Carolina coming out to play, the search for a coach in the Big Apple (Babcock?), Landeskog out for all of next season, Draft Lottery and Chicago’s rebuild. Transcript

item.title: Panther Meat | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down Toronto’s Game 3 performance, give credit to Seattle and New Jersey, continue to marvel at Leon Draisaitl, provide some news from around the league and chat Draft Lottery. Transcript

item.title: How About Bob? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte recap Game 2 Panthers-Maple Leafs and Kraken-Stars, discuss Oilers-Golden Knights and Devils-Canes, talk about the Norris Trophy finalists, Snoop Dogg, and remember the late Petr Klima. Transcript

item.title: Kraken 5, Pavelski 4 | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte talk Panthers-Leafs as well as Kraken-Stars (Pavelski), preview Edmonton-Las Vegas & New Jersey-Carolina, talk about the schedule and look at the off-season for the Rangers, Bruins & Flames. Transcript

item.title: Wow! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte wrap up what might have been one of the craziest weekends in hockey – Kyle Dubas and the Leafs, Patrice Bergeron, Kraken advance, embellishment, Jets, Ottawa sale and much more! Transcript

item.title: Bowness Blast | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the post-game press conference from Rick Bowness, go through several of the series, and provide an update on Calgary’s GM search and Anaheim’s coaching search. Transcript

item.title: Jordan Martinook | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte sit down with Jordan Martinook to talk about his Gordie Howe hat trick, Mr. Svechnikov, Canada’s best band, coming up with ideas for the Storm Surge, and riding the bus with Brent Burns (and his backpack). Transcript

item.title: Puck Face | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss each series starting with the Kings-Oilers, debate the Foligno-Faksa hit as well as the Makar-McCann, tip their hat to MacKenzie Weegar (arena deal in Calgary), and some news out of Anaheim. Transcript

item.title: Jack To The Rescue | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down each series from the weekend, discuss Émilie Castonguay choosing to stay with the Canucks and take an interested listener question. Transcript

item.title: Mark Stoned | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte go through each of the first-round series as things begin to ramp up through two games, talk about Mark Stone’s return, the Ryan O’Reilly feature and the officiating. Transcript

item.title: What Now Toronto? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description We’re back three days a week for the playoffs! Jeff and Elliotte recap game 1 of each of the series, wonder what’s next for the Flames as they look for a new GM and new names enter the fold in the search for a president in Philadelphia. Transcript

item.title: Playoff Time! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte preview every first-round series in the Stanley Cup Playoffs, provide more details on some of the changes around the league and do an off-season wrap on the teams that were eliminated. Transcript

item.title: Black Friday | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the front office changes in Pittsburgh, the Ducks firing their head coach, what some of the eliminated teams might do this off-season and the send-off for Jonathan Toews in Chicago. Transcript

item.title: Rod Brind’Amour | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Elliotte sat down with Rod Brind’Amour in Ottawa to talk about his son Skyler winning the Frozen Four, the culture around the Hurricanes, his relationship with Tom Dundon, the 2006 Stanley Cup and officiating in the NHL. Transcript

item.title: Five More Days | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down a crazy weekend of hockey, discuss some college signings as well as Bo Horvat & Chris Wideman’s post-game comments, and Elliotte sits down with Noel Acciari of the Toronto Maple Leafs. Transcript

item.title: Coffee, Grunge & Playoff Hockey | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte give credit to the Seattle Kraken for an impressive second season, discuss the wild card race in the East & West, detail the situation with the Chicago Wolves and wonder how healthy the Bolts will be going into the playoffs. Transcript

item.title: Wyatt Johnston | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff Marek sits down with rookie standout Wyatt Johnston at the American Airlines Center in Dallas to talk about his 20-goal season, living with Joe Pavelski and Marc Savard’s tape job. Transcript

item.title: It’s Just A Flesh Wound | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte tip their hat to Brayden Schenn on his eventful weekend and Kris Letang on his 1000th game, NHL going to Australia, the marketing plan put forth by Ryan Reynolds, and the Jets & Flames making things interesting. Transcript

item.title: Dinner Date | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss Gary Bettman’s dinner with Ryan Smith (Utah Jazz & Real Salt Lake owner), the media conference held by Marty Walsh, Scott Howson vs some AHL teams, and a fun game in Ottawa. Transcript

item.title: Max Domi | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description While in Dallas, Max Domi joined Jeff to talk about his new club, the situation with his teeth, being a pass-first player, finding the right stick, growing up around great hockey players, and playing under Pete DeBoer. Transcript

item.title: Tin Foil Hats | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte put their tin foil hats on when talking about the Maple Leafs, wonder what the future is for the Jets core, discuss why we’re seeing more physical play this late into the season, and they take your questions! Transcript

item.title: Cheech | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the comments made by Connor McDavid about the WBC, the 10-year NHL x Fanatics deal, John Garrett leaving the Canucks broadcast, and Jason Robertson joins the podcast. Transcript

item.title: Our Lone Star Itinerary | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are in Dallas chatting about the Stars, fighting in hockey/after clean hits, the sale of the Senators, Martin St. Louis sitting Jonathan Drouin and James Reimer refusing to wear the Sharks Pride-themed jersey. Transcript

item.title: Jay Woodcroft | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte chat with Oilers head coach Jay Woodcroft about video sessions with Connor McDavid, his time with Mike Babcock in Detroit, coaching 3-on-3, and the perfect length of a video session. Transcript

item.title: FTRH | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte (in Florida) discuss the Daniel Brière press conference, a weekend of opposites for the Senators and Jets, what to expect at this week’s GM Meetings and they answer your questions. Transcript

item.title: Flyer Friday | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the changes in Philadelphia, the latest on the sale of the Ottawa Senators, upcoming GM meetings, and some exciting games down the stretch including Vegas-Tampa & Edmonton-Boston. Transcript

item.title: Here’s What Didn’t Happen | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the trades that didn’t go down and topics for the upcoming GM meetings, wonder where the Flyers go from here, and tip their hat to Jakob Chychrun on his debut with the Senators. Transcript

item.title: Thank God It's Over | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte wrap up a wild trade deadline week by discussing the Flyers, talks between Pittsburgh and Vancouver, the state of the Coyotes, Ottawa making a playoff push and Boston coming out on top. Transcript

item.title: Bill Guerin | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by Minnesota Wild GM, Bill Guerin, for a lengthy chat about the trade deadline, the upcoming GM Meetings, how he manages his cap as well as his relationship with his owner, and how he’s not afraid of change. Transcript

item.title: Deadline Sunday | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte preview all 32 teams wants/needs as we near the trade deadline and discuss what was a crazy Sunday in hockey with the Predators changing things up and the Devils trading for Timo Meier. Transcript

item.title: Eastern Octagon | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte continue to work the Patrick Kane situation, discuss the Boston-Washington trade and focus on the Keystone State as trade rumours begin to really heat up. Transcript

item.title: Jake Allen | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Montreal goaltender Jake Allen joins Jeff and Elliotte for an in-depth chat about goalie gear, analyzing a play before a shot, he builds us the perfect goalie and tells us what it’s like playing with Carey Price. Transcript

item.title: Big Daddy Kane | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte talk Patrick Kane, the big trade between the Maple Leafs-Blues-Wild, latest on Timo Meier and Jakob Chychrun, they break down some of the buyers and sellers and explain why Joonas Korpisalo might be a good trade chip. Transcript

item.title: Here's What We Know | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte talk about trade talk around Tyler Bertuzzi, what the Blues and Golden Knights might be doing, the Oilers seem to be open for business, Chicago has some decisions to make and the guys remember two great men of the game. Transcript

item.title: Mark Giordano | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Mark Giordano joins Jeff and Elliotte from the Maple Leafs practice facility inside the NHL Alumni office to talk about his hockey journey, being a leader on the team and what it means to him as he approaches the all-time blocked shots record. Transcript

item.title: Drama In The Desert | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Coyotes tweets about Jakob Chychrun, whether or not Erik Karlsson could be headed to Edmonton, take some listener questions, and much more. Transcript

item.title: Tarasenk-Go | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Vladimir Tarasenko trade, present some suitors for Timo Meier including the Devils and Maple Leafs, talk about Bo Horvat playing the Canucks and they close the book on All-Star. Transcript

item.title: Juuse Saros | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description While in Florida, Jeff and Elliotte chatted with Preds All-Star goaltender, Juuse Saros, about his season, returning from injury, his draft year, being an undersized goalie and his tattoos. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte recap the Heritage Classic in Hamilton, discuss Toronto’s goaltending issues, potential moves on the horizon, some big news from the PWHPA, and they celebrate their 300th episode with their family. Transcript

item.title: Whistles Away | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte (in his car) recap a week that saw some questionable calls around the league, discuss the goaltending situation in Toronto and the play of the red hot Coyotes, Jack Eichel’s return to Buffalo, and the latest from Philadelphia. Transcript

item.title: The Hot Stove Is Heating Up | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte give credit to Jason Robertson and Nick Schmaltz, touch on players of interest as we near the trade deadline, and discuss the comments made by Angela James regarding the state of women’s hockey. Transcript

item.title: 61 on 32 | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Rick Nash joins the podcast to talk about his jersey retirement in Columbus and shares some of his favourite stories from his career. The guys also discuss the unstoppable Rangers, Jon Cooper getting ejected versus the Penguins and Jeff apologizes for a puck-ing mistake he made on the Monday podcast. Transcript

item.title: Meet Juraj Slafkovsky | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Juraj Slafkovsky is 17 years old, and he was voted the 2022 men’s Olympic hockey MVP. He joined Jeff and Elliotte to talk about his Olympic journey, winning bronze for Slovakia, finding his scoring touch, his favourite team/player, and if he takes any stock in NHL Draft rankings. Transcript

item.title: IIHF Rules On Russia | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the decision by the IIHF as it relates to Russian and Belarusian athletes and the 2023 World Juniors, the meeting in Arizona with the Coyotes and the NHLPA, and the wild Saturday night in Detriot. Transcript

item.title: Forsberg, Jets, Hawks & Leafs | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss how a pair of North American players in the KHL are handling the conflict in Ukraine and what sporting events we might see cancelled in Russia, they continue to marvel at Zdeno Chára, wonder what Nashville will do with Filip Forsberg, and how Jake Muzzin going on LTIR will impact the Maple Leafs. Transcript

item.title: Leafs Get A Lyub Job | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the trade between the Maple Leafs and Coyotes, discuss Montreal’s mini win streak and their interest in Marie-Philip Poulin, and they break down the latest from Chicago’s GM search. Transcript

item.title: Carcast From The Rink | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte (while in his car) recap the heavyweight tilt between the Penguins and Maple Leafs, discuss the Claude Giroux press conference and where he might land, and wonder what Vancouver might be looking to do with some of their stars. Transcript

item.title: Alex Pietrangelo on Jack Eichel’s Return and Life After Hockey | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by Stanley Cup Champion, Alex Pietrangelo, to talk about his All-Star game experience, the return of Jack Eichel, his friendship with Jay Bouwmeester, and the importance of preparing for life after hockey. Transcript

item.title: Toffoli Traded & Eichel Returns | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Tyler Toffoli trade to Calgary, Sidney Crosby’s pursuit of 500 goals, the Oilers under Jay Woodcroft, the return of Jack Eichel this week, and Rosie DiManno’s opinion piece in the Toronto Star. Transcript

item.title: What A Week! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte kick things off with an apology before getting into some rapid-fire thoughts from Elliotte’s latest blog, discuss the changes in Edmonton and Montreal, Vancouver hiring Cammi Granato, and the arena situation in Arizona. Transcript

item.title: News Breaks & Vegas Recap | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte recap All-Star Weekend in Las Vegas, discuss the Gary Bettman and Bill Daly press conference, and news breaks during the recording session that Chicago had fired their AHL athletic trainer for sexual harassment Transcript

item.title: Succession | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the comments made by Rocky Wirtz at the Chicago Blackhawks town hall, Pat Verbeek’s first move as the new general manager of the Anaheim Ducks, and Elliotte tells us about his conversations with David Poile, Bill Guerin, and Rob Blake. Transcript

item.title: Shutting Down The Las Vegas Strip | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Steve Mayer is the Chief Content Officer at the NHL. He joins Jeff and Elliotte to discuss All-Star Weekend in Las Vegas, how they are using the Bellagio Fountain and why they are shutting down the strip, and what it will take to get backwards skating into the skills competition. Transcript

item.title: Price Speaks and Is ‘The Michigan’ Boring | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Carey Price press conference, wonder what’s next for the Canadiens and the Canucks, provide an update on Anaheim’s GM search, tell us why they love jersey retirement ceremonies, and debate if the ‘The Michigan’ is now boring. Transcript

item.title: Edmonton’s Gamble, Arizona’s Downsize | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte explain how Evander Kane became an Oiler, discuss the arena situation in Arizona as well as the press conference in Philadelphia, and provide an update on the GM search in Chicago and Anaheim. Transcript

item.title: Meet the new Executive Director of the PHF Players’ Association | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Alex Sinatra is a Texas-barred attorney who is the new executive director of the PHFPA. She tells Jeff and Elliotte why she took the job and how her career path guided her to hockey. She also talks about some of her early priorities, challenges, potential partnerships and what’s important to the players. Transcript

item.title: A Hard Look Back, And Then A Look Ahead | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss a pair of incidents that took place in the AHL and the ECHL, and they express their frustration as racist behaviour continues to be seen and heard in the game of hockey. Transcript

item.title: Barkov Breaks The Oilers & Ryan Getzlaf Joins The Podcast | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte chat with Ducks captain Ryan Getzlaf, discuss the Oilers struggles after a 6-0 loss to the Panthers, Sheldon Keefe’s post-game comments, provide more updates on Vancouver’s GM search, marvel at Victor Hedman’s dominance, a few thoughts on Brad Marchand, and a few more teams are added to the Jakob Chychrun trade list. Transcript

item.title: Could Be A Newsy Week | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte wonder what the Oilers will do next as they fall to the Senators, discuss Montreal’s GM search and give some background on player agent Kent Hughes (who is in the running for the job), and explain why Florida is the real deal this season. Transcript

item.title: Like An Old Married Couple | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Evander Kane situation and how the Canadian Border Services Agency is involved, the Ken Holland press conference, Bobby Clarke’s comments on Ron Hextall, the Panthers and Kodak Black, and All-Star snubs. Transcript

item.title: Devan Dubnyk on the Olympics, Burning Rubber & Goalie Fights | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte chat with Devan Dubnyk about his desire to play on Canada’s Olympic team, getting back in game shape, the smell of burning rubber, the hardest shot he ever faced, almost fighting Jordan Binnington, and his favourite goalie growing up. Transcript

item.title: A Wild Weekend Of Surprises | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the situation between Evander Kane and the San Jose Sharks, Rob Blake’s contract extension and the Kings hiring Marc Bergevin as a senior advisor to the GM, continued trade talks around Jakob Chychrun, the John Klingberg negotiation, and more updates out of Edmonton. Transcript

item.title: Elliotte’s DMs Are Open | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Could the Winnipeg Jets be playing their homes games in Saskatoon? Jeff and Elliotte discuss the results of the season ticket holder survey sent out by the team and the logistics required to execute such a move. They also touch on the return of Tuukka Rask, how Edmonton could save their season, and why Sidney Crosby is still fantastic. Transcript

item.title: What To Watch For In 2022 | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description After a bit of a break, Jeff and Elliotte kick things off by explaining what the league might do with the schedule going forward, tell you some stories that they’ll be keeping an eye on in 2022, and take a few of your questions as well as a voicemail from the Thought Line. Transcript

item.title: Mark Messier on Winning (and Losing), Costumes & Commercials | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by six-time Stanley Cup champion Mark Messier to talk about his new book. No One Wins Alone. The guys ask Mark about his younger days hanging out with the Portland Buckaroos, if he had a certain way of winning, the type of player he’d be in today’s game, why Halloween parties were so important to him, and they talk about some of his more memorable commercials.

item.title: 2nd Annual 32 Thoughts Holiday Party | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description As say goodbye to 2021, Jeff and Elliotte invite some of their favourite people from around Sportsnet to their second annual 32 Thoughts holiday party. Sit back, grab a drink and enjoy some holiday fun with the crew. Transcript

item.title: Some Other Things to Talk About | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down what was a difficult weekend around the league as more teams were shut down, talk Alex Tuch and his much-expected debut for the Sabres as well as Robin Lehner’s return to Long Island, tell us what team isn’t interested in Jakob Chychrun, and discuss potential front-office candidates in Vancouver. Transcript

item.title: Emergency Podcast! Paul Maurice and the Jets | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte break down Paul Maurice’s resignation and Dave Lowry being named interim head coach. They also discuss why a number of teams are shut down until Christmas and how much money Montreal lost by not allowing fans in the arena. Transcript

item.title: Everyone’s Favourite Discussion | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss COVID-19 protocols around the sports world, the impact the virus is having on the league, trade talks around Jakob Chychrun, Vancouver finding their stride as they begin to make hires, Pittsburgh’s surprising run, why this might be the weirdest NHL season, and they take a real interest question from the thought line. Transcript

item.title: Olympic-Sized Headache | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss some of the main takeaways from the NHL Board of Governors meeting in Florida which included the Olympics, the search for a general manager in Vancouver, what’s happening with the Bruins, how the Oilers are looking to improve their roster and they take some of your questions. Transcript

item.title: Hunka Hunka Burning Glove | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Elvis Merzlikins joins the podcast! But before that, Jeff and Elliotte discuss the Jason Spezza suspension, player safety, changes in Philadelphia, and the Zegras to Milano goal. Transcript

item.title: Time Has Come For The Canucks | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Vancouver Canucks fired their head coach and general manager on Sunday. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the changes in western Canada, the timing of them, the hiring of Bruce Boudreau and the impact he may have on the players, and why it was time to move on from Jim Benning. Transcript

item.title: Houston, We Have a Problem | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the report that the Arizona Coyotes could be for sale, they dissect the situation in Ottawa, discuss the Rob Brind’Amour fine and answer a few listener emails. Transcript

item.title: Manic Monday Montreal | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss the changes in Montreal, the struggling Flyers, Ottawa placing Matt Murray on waivers, Evander Kane finds new representation as he is put on waivers by the Sharks, concerns over the All-Star Game, and Brendan Lemieux biting Brady Tkachuk. Transcript

item.title: Canucks, Islanders and Stuff(ing) | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte wonder if we’ll see changes in Vancouver, how the Islanders are managing their roster around COVID protocol, how the All-Star game might look a bit different this season to limit the exposure to COVID-19 leading into the Olympics, why the Avalanche gave Jared Bednar a two-year extension, hot starts for Alexander Ovechkin and Nazem Kadri, and they answer some of your emails and voicemails. Transcript

item.title: There's A Lot Going On | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte cover off a lot of stories including another tough loss for the Canucks, if there’s something going between Kevin Fiala and the Wild, they provide an update on the Omaha Lancers situation, discuss interest by the Fenway Sports Group in purchasing the Pittsburgh Penguins, and Islanders open their new arena but are hit by heavy COVID-19 protocol. Transcript

item.title: Canucks on the Clock | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Vancouver is having a hard time finding its groove. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the struggling Canucks, what might be going wrong, possible changes, and how the market is reacting to the slow start. The guys also touch on Montreal, the Islanders coming home last place in the Metro, feedback from the Mike Forde interview, protecting the stars and how it might increase attendance, the situation with the Omaha Lancers, and they take some emails and your voicemails.

item.title: Reorganizing Your Organization | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by Mike Forde, Executive Chairman at Sportsology — a company that advises sports franchises on talent management and the creation of high-performance cultures. They discuss his scope of work in world sport (particularly in hockey, soccer and basketball), understanding the needs of an ownership group, their process in finding inefficiencies within an organizational structure, and some of the challenges that come with managing expectations in multilingual environments.

item.title: 32 Goalie Thoughts - Part 2 | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Kevin Woodley of In Goal Magazine & NHL.com is back to talk …. goalies! Jeff and Kevin discuss active goalie pads (1;30), goaltenders taking their training off the ice using virtual reality (8:00), pad design (17:00), the reverse-VH (20:30) and they take a voicemail question about the Boston Bruins goaltending situation (22:30). Transcript

item.title: 32 Goalie Thoughts – Part 1 | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you like goalies, this episode is for you! Jeff is joined by “The Goalie Whisperer” from In Goal Magazine, Kevin Woodley. They cover off a lot from between the pipes like how goaltenders have had to adapt to new shooting styles (44:00) to the rise of elite Russian goaltenders (11:15) over the last few years. The guys also discuss different goaltending styles around the league and highlight some amazing performances so far this season — Igor Shesterkin (19:30), Andrei Vasilevskiy (7:30), Thatcher Demko (26:00), Robin Lehner (32:00), Jack Campbell (35:00) and Craig Anderson (40:00).

item.title: Weekend Update | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Chicago fires head coach Jeremy Colliton and assistant coaches Tomas Mitell and Sheldon Brookbank. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the promotion of Rockford head coach Derek King (2:10), the level of freedom interim GM Kyle Davidson has within the organization, and if this is a lost season for the Blackhawks. They also touch on Jack Eichel’s arrival in Las Vegas (17:00), Ottawa recalling Erik Brannstrom from Belleville (17:45), the Maple Leafs finding their groove (25:00), St.

item.title: The Eich-stravaganza | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Buffalo Sabres have traded Jack Eichel! Elliotte tells us about his exclusive sit-down with the newest member of the Vegas Golden Knights (00:01) and when he plans to make his return to play. The guys then break down the Jack Eichel saga from every perspective including Eichel’s (8:45), Terry and Kim Pegula (15:00), Kevyn Adams (19:00), Pat Brisson (23:45), Vegas Golden Knights (27:30), Calgary Flames (32:00), Carolina Hurricanes (38:30) and the NHL (43:30).

item.title: Should They Do It Again? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The League has spoken. The NHLPA is speaking. Kevin Cheveldayoff will speak soon. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the press conference held by commissioner Gary Bettman and deputy commissioner Bill Daly on Monday and provide some details around the executive board meeting held by the NHLPA. Music Outro: Michael Wilford – Rattle My Bones (ft. Sail Cassady) Listen to the full track by Michael Wilford here This podcast is produced and mixed by Amil Delic, and hosted by Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman.

item.title: Where Are We Going? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description That’s the question. Jeff and Elliotte take an in-depth look at the Kyle Beach story and where it might be headed following the findings from the Chicago Blackhawks internal investigation. They address the news of Kevin Cheveldayoff not facing discipline (5:00), Joel Quenneville resigning (11:00), Donald Fehr and the NHLPA (15:45), players from the 2010 Blackhawks roster (20:40), Gary Bettman and the NHL (27:50), and where Chicago as a club goes from here (44:00).

item.title: A Brief Statement | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Transcript

item.title: Early Season Panic | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A pair of Orginal Six teams are really struggling out of the gates. Jeff and Elliotte discuss why the Leafs (00:01) aren’t playing to their potential, if changes are needed in Chicago (23:00) and list off some coaching candidates that are currently on the market (27:00). They also talk about the Red Wings and their rookies (39:00), provide more news regarding Jack Eichel (42:00), the price for Vitali Kravtsov (47:00), interest in Barrett Hayton (48:00), Seattle’s home opener (50:00) and they take some of your questions (54:00).

item.title: “It’s Not Revenge?” | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description And the Carolina Hurricanes continue to haunt the Montreal Canadiens. Jeff and Elliotte recap Jesperi Kotkaniemi’s return to the Bell Centre (00:01), chuckle at what they saw post-game on social media and discuss Montreal’s early struggles. They also chat about Brady Tkachuk’s return to the Senators (17:00), the goaltending situation in Calgary (20:00), Winnipeg getting it done shorthanded (23:00), Quinn Hughes continues to impress (27:00), the early season challenges (on and off the ice) in Chicago (29:00), the youthful Blues (41:30) and the winner by Vladimir Tarasenko (37:00), what we might see with the Rangers and Vitaly Kravtsov (51:00), and much more

item.title: ZEE-RO CHANCE! (stay till the end of the podcast) | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte debut their new segment on Hockey Night in Canada! They talk about the experience (00:01) and some of the topics from the segment including extension talks for John Klingberg (4:30), more Eichel updates (14:30), shortened rosters (42:00) and the new standards for officials (50:00). They also touch on Colorado being in on almost every big-name player (23:00), Montreal losing some of their identity (10:45 & 28:45), injuries in Vegas (25:45), the Jack Hughes goal and celebration (36:30) and they answer some of your emails (57:30).

item.title: And Then There Were None. Everyone is Signed! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The season is underway and the 32 Thoughts podcast is back for its fifth season! Jeff and Elliotte give their thoughts on the first few days of action (37:00), break down the Nick Suzuki contract (10:15) along with Ryan Pulock’s deal with the Islanders (31:20), Senators signing Brady Tkachuk (00:01), chat about Alexander Ovechkin’s season opener (23:30), the Bruins and Charlie McAvoy (13:30) and the Predators signing Mattias Ekholm to a 4-year contract (27:30).

item.title: Western Conference Preview | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte preview the NHL’s Western Conference by division in alphabetical order. Pacific Division Anaheim (1:20), Calgary (2:50), Oilers (4:50), Los Angles (7:35), San Jose (10:10), Seattle (13:25), Vancouver (15:15) and Vegas (17:50) Central Division Arizona (20:45), Chicago (24:10), Colorado (26:20), Dallas (27:30), Minnesota (29:10), Nashville (32:00), St. Louis (35:50) and Winnipeg (39:00) Music Outro: The Magnolia – Stormy Weather Listen to more tracks from The Magnolia here

item.title: Eastern Conference Preview | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte preview the NHL’s Eastern Conference by division in alphabetical order. Metropolitan Division Carolina (3:30), Columbus (4:45), New Jersey (8:15), New York Islanders (12:10), New York Rangers (12:50), Philadelphia (20:20), Pittsburg (25:40) and Washington (28:20) Atlantic Division Boston (31:10), Buffalo (34:00), Detroit (39:00), Florida (42:10), Montreal (45:50). Ottawa (51:00), Tampa Bay (54:50) and Toronto (56:50) Music Outro: Delicate Steve – Peaches Listen to more tracks from Delicate Steve here

item.title: Seth Jones, Anders Lee & Tim Stützle | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Seth Jones of the Chicago Blackhawks joins Jeff and Elliotte (7:00) to talk about his eventful off-season, playing with his brother this season, knowing your worth, the new additions to the Blackhawks and what went down in Columbus last season. The guys then chat with Anders Lee (19:00) about his love of dogs and Gordie Howe, resigning with the Islanders, his announcement tweet, playing without Jordan Eberle this season, his relationship with Lou Lamoriello and his recovery.

item.title: The In-Season Stanley Cup | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte have talked about doing the in-season Stanley Cup challenge for a couple of seasons but never had the time to coordinate it. But this season, they found the time and some friends to do it with! The guys are joined by David Amber and Caroline Cameron of Sportsnet in the first annual 32 Thoughts In-Season Stanley Cup challenge. The rules are simple. In the snake draft, each player drafts 8 NHL teams.

item.title: Robin Lehner Speaks Out | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Over the weekend Robin Lehner went to Twitter to address the Jack Eichel situation, how the Sabres handled his ankle injury, teams giving “benzodiazepines to employees when they travel and Ambien”, and the treatment of players in Philadelphia by Alan Vigneault. Jeff and Elliotte address Lehner’s tweets (00:01) and discuss how teams, the league and the NHLPA might handle the comments. They also touch on Elias Pettersson and Quinn Hughes (23:30) resigning with the Canucks, Travis Hamonic deciding to play this season (31:00), and 31 Thoughts: The Ripoff by Isabella Cadotte.

item.title: Darnell Nurse, Matthew Tkachuk & Andrew Mangiapane | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Darnell Nurse (10:00) chats with Jeff and Elliotte about his new contract with the Oilers and the negotiation process, playing and living with Connor McDavid, and a book that helped him manage his emotions throughout the season. Matthew Tkachuk (21:30) joins the podcast to talk about the struggles his team had last season, managing emotions throughout the year, being coached by Darryl Sutter, playing without Mark Giordano, and his talks with his younger brother Brady about his contract negotiation with Ottawa.

item.title: A Proposal for the NHL’s Eichel Problem | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The news pods are back! Jeff and Elliotte kick off this episode by previewing the upcoming “All or Nothing: Toronto Maple Leafs” docuseries on Amazon Prime (00:01) as they had the opportunity to screen it before its release on October 1st. They then discuss the ongoing Jack Eichel situation in Buffalo and wonder if the NHL should get involved (19:00), provide some updates on the contract negotiations between Vancouver and their high profiled RFAs (28:10), what’s happening with Travis Hamonic (30:45), Seattle plays its first game in franchise history (32:00), Brady Tkachuk and the Senators continue talks (36:00), questions in New Jersey as they deal with an unvaccinated player on their roster (38:00), the Blues lock up their GM and make a trade with the Sens (45:00), Arizona hires John Ferguson Jr.

item.title: Nathan MacKinnon, Drew Doughty & Steven Stamkos | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Nathan Mackinnon (15:00) addresses the Nikita Zadorov comments from the summer, the importance of Gabriel Landeskog to the Avalanche, the process in Colorado, how he overcomes the feeling of being hesitant on the ice, and he tells the guys about an interesting line he played against this summer (that we could potentially see at the Olympics). Drew Doughty (30:00) tells Jeff and Elliotte how it feels to be gunning for the Stanley Cup playoffs this season, his determination to make the Olympic team, what he would like to do post-career, the excitement to finally have fans back in arenas, and he clears the air around a certain story from the 2010 Olympics.

item.title: Auston Matthews, Mitch Marner, Tyler Toffoli & Nick Suzuki | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Auston Matthews (11:20) talks about his eventful off-season, how he’s feeling after his wrist surgery, what he’s excited about most this season, and he reflects on last season. Mitch Marner (24:30) discusses how he plans on blocking out the noise, staying in touch with Auston Matthews throughout the summer, what he was best known for off the ice while with the London Knights, and potentially representing his country at the Olympics.

item.title: Bill Daly, Marc-André Fleury & Jack Hughes | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Bill Daly joins Jeff and Elliotte (10:00) to talk about arena capacity, salary cap, Olympics, COVID-19 protocol, Evander Kane, the Chicago Blackhawks investigation, data-tracking pucks, gambling, and the Arizona Coyotes. Marc Andre-Fleury joins the podcast (26:45) to talk about his trade to Chicago, how this could potentially be his last season, most memorable moments from his time in Vegas, and how goaltending has changed since he joined the league.

item.title: Pierre-Luc Dubois, Mark Scheifele & Jason Dickinson | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Pierre-Luc Dubois chats with Jeff and Elliotte (7:20) about his skate-filled summer, focusing on his physical and mental health, watching different players around the league, and why he likes playing with Russian players. Mark Scheifele joins the podcast (27:00) to chat about his skates with Ryan O’Reilly and Adam Oates in Lucan, Ontario, how he spent his summer, the aftermath following the hit on Jake Evans, keeping an eye on the Olympics, and his favourite Olympic hockey memory.

item.title: What’s In A Name? From the NWHL to the PHF | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The National Women’s Hockey League (NWHL) is rebranding to become the Premier Hockey Federation (PHF). Tyler Tumminia, the commissioner of the PHF, joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about the rebrand, why they made the change, conversations with other leagues, why they took “women” out of the league name, how does a rebrand of a league work behind the scenes, why they went with “federation”, ongoing talks with the NHL, and if they hope to attract more players by rebranding the league.

item.title: Kot-CANE-emi | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jesperi Kotkaniemi is a member of the Caroline Hurricanes. Jeff and Elliotte break down what went wrong between Kotkaniemi and Montreal Canadiens (00:01), why it’s challenging to find a quality centre in the NHL (Christian Dvorak traded to the Canadiens), what Carolina expects from Kotkaniemi, and if teams will view offer sheets differently going forward. They also discuss other possible offer sheet candidates like Brady Tkachuk (26:30), provide an update on a pair of contract negotiations — Elias Pettersson and Quinn Hughes (28:00) as well as Kirill Kaprizov (28:30), and the guys wrap up the podcast by saying a few words about the late Jimmy Hayes (34:00).

item.title: Summer Offer Sheet Special | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Caroline Hurricanes strike back — two years later! On Saturday, the Canes tendered an offer sheet to restricted free agent Jesperi Kotkaniemi for one-year, $6.1-million. Jeff and Elliotte break down some of the details and possible thinking behind the offer sheet (1:30), discuss how Carolina decided to present the announcement publicly, contract extension talks between Kotkaniemi and the Canadiens, and the reaction out of Montreal. They also touch on the Jack Eichel situation (18:30), why he chose to change his representation and the big meeting that took place a few weeks back in Buffalo.

item.title: Braiden Epp: Ready For The Fight | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Earlier this year, the former captain of the Prince George Spruce Kings turned referee was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis. When 24-year-old Braiden Epp received the news, he quickly got involved in helping to find a cure for the disease. Braiden joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about some of the challenges he has faced since being diagnosed, why it was important to him and his peers to begin raising funds, getting back on the ice, memories from his junior hockey days, sharing the ice with Mathew Barzal, what he enjoys most about refereeing and the guys give Braiden a couple of in-game calls that a referee is forced to make but drive fans crazy.

item.title: Here’s 32 Thoughts | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description What a season! Jeff and Elliotte provide their thoughts on all 32 teams and what we might see from some GMs in the coming days/weeks. They also touch on the Evander Kane gambling allegations (00:00) and provide some context to the situation. Pacific: Ducks (6:00), Flames (9:00), Oilers (10:30), Kings (16:30), Sharks (19:10), Kraken (21:00), Canucks (23:00), Vegas (27:00) Central: Coyotes (33:45), Blackhawks (36:20), Avalanche (39:00), Stars (43:00), Wild (46:15), Predators (48:15), Blues (49:20), Jets (52:20)

item.title: Why Eichel Wants a Disc Replacement | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Dr. Chad Prusmack is a neurosurgeon based in Colorado who has provided Jack Eichel with a recommendation to correct a herniated disc in his neck by proceeding with artificial disc replacement surgery. Jeff and Elliotte chat with Dr. Prusmack about the procedure, the recovery and the risk associated with the surgery, and why this surgery would be more beneficial long-term rather than an anterior cervical discectomy with fusion (ACDF).

item.title: The Good and Bad of Draft Weekend | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description It was almost a perfect week for the NHL. Jeff and Elliotte kick off the podcast (00:00) discussing how the first round of the draft ended, how surprised they were by Montreal picking Logan Mailloux, if this can be avoided in the future, and how Chicago decided to make their first-round selection. They also chat about the Seth Jones trade to Chicago (12:00), the rebuild in Columbus (20:50), a busy week for the Flyers (22:40), Buffalo trading Sam Reinhart (28:00), the latest on Jack Eichel (29:45), Vancouver trading for Oliver Ekman-Larsson and Conor Garland (34:00), Colorado gets one deal done but still have another with Gabriel Landeskog (43:00), where might we see Dougie Hamilton next season (49:30) and things to watch for this week (52:30).

item.title: Quick Expansion Chat | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Seattle Kraken has chosen their roster. Jeff and Elliotte talk about the day leading up to the expansion draft, why the Kraken didn’t pick up Carey Price (4:00), if Mark Giordano will be on the 2021-22 Seattle Kraken roster, and some thoughts on the overall team. They also discuss Adam Larrson’s time in Edmonton (15:20), the high demand for Jamie Oleksiak, the Taylor Hall contract, and much more.

item.title: The Price is Right? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Seattle Kraken are going to have some fun this week. Jeff and Elliotte open up the podcast with a deep dive into what they have been hearing out of Montreal (00:00), Seattle’s potential interest in Carey Price, and the risks associated with picking up the Vezina winning goaltender. They also discuss the situation in Colorado between the Avalanche and Gabriel Landeskog (15:00), the Rangers signing Barclay Goodrow (20:00), what they are hearing around Jack Eichel (22:50) and Jaden Schwartz (24:30), if Yanni Gourde is more than just a third line centre (28:30), what a contract for Zach Hyman might look like (32:00), much more.

item.title: This is Luke Prokop’s podcast | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Luke Prokop, Calgary Hitmen defencemen and Nashville Predators prospect. Hi everyone. While the past year and a half has been crazy, it has also given me the chance to find my true self. I am no longer scared to hide who I am. Today I am proud to publicly tell everyone that I am gay. It has been quite the journey to get to this point in my life, but I could not be happier with my decision to come out.

item.title: Avalanche Prevention | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The New Jersey Devils have acquired Ryan Graves from the Colorado Avalanche for Mikhail Maltsev and a second-round pick. Jeff and Elliotte break down the deal (00:00), what this means for Colorado and how New Jersey might approach their off-season with over $30 million in cap space (3:00). They also discuss the Gabriel Landeskog contract negotiation (6:00), Zach Hyman (15:00), the goaltending situation in Toronto (20:00), some news out of Vancouver (18:00), and what Montreal might do with Shea Weber (27:00).

item.title: Listen before everything changes! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description We lead the podcast off with some breaking news! The Minnesota Wild buy out the remaining four years of Zach Parise and Ryan Suter (00:00), the Canadiens agree to a three-year extension with head coach Dominique Ducharme (10:00), and Pekka Rinne calls it a career (11:00). Duncan Keith is officially an Edmonton Oiler. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the trade between the Oilers and Blackhawks in detail (15:00), explain why (from their perspective) Ken Holland felt like it was the right move, and what the acquisition of Caleb Jones means for Chicago (32:00).

item.title: Lightning Strikes Twice | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Tampa Bay Lightning are the 2020-21 Stanley Cup champions. Jeff and Elliotte discuss (00:00) the Conn Smythe winning performance of Andrei Vasilevskiy, the entertaining post-game press conference from Nikita Kucherov, the play of the Tampa defense, and why the team was more motivated than ever before. The guys also touch on what the Stanley Cup loss might mean for the Canadiens (23:30), the Carey Price and Shea Weber post-game press conference, finding that game breaker in the off-season, and if the club will resign Phillip Danault,

item.title: Back to Florida | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Montreal Canadiens find a way to extend the series. Jeff and Elliotte recap an exciting game 4 in Montreal (2:00), discuss the impact of Shea Weber throughout the game, wonder if there were more than 3500 fans in attendance at the Bell Centre and go over the lineup changes made by both coaches. They also break down the latest from Buffalo with Jack Eichel (20:30) and the hiring Sam Ventura (21:30) as the new VP of Hockey Strategy and Research, try to explain the hold up on the potential Duncan Keith trade (25:45) and they say a few words about the late Matiss Kivlenieks.

item.title: Devin Buffalo: Inspiring Indigenous Youth | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte are joined by former professional goaltender and the owner of Waniska Athletics, Devin Buffalo. Devin tells the guys about his path to Dartmouth College, playing junior hockey in Flin Flon, why it’s important to him to inspire the Indigenous youth of today, who he looked up to growing up, how visualization helped him get to where he is today, and he shares some of his experiences as an Indigenous goaltender.

item.title: Guelph Jammies | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Lightning continue to power through the Canadiens. Jeff and Elliotte recap game 3 of the Stanley Cup final (00:00), discuss the impact of Tyler Johnson and the impressive play of (injured) Nikita Kucherov, and explain how Conn Smythe voting works. Plus, they try to figure out where to get some Guelph Gryphons pajamas. They also chat about the 8-year contract extension for Joel Eriksson Ek (24:15), L.A. Kings trading picks to acquire Viktor Arvidsson (27:30), what this trade means for Los Angeles (30:00), the ongoing talks around Duncan Keith (32:15), and Elliotte tells us about his first in-arena experience in well over a year (35:30).

item.title: Two Mistakes | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Canadiens outshoot the Lightning but don’t end up on top. Jeff and Elliotte break down game 2 (00:00), the play of the goaltenders, and how each goal had an interesting path to the back of the net. They also discuss the upcoming hire of Andre Tourigny as the new head coach in Arizona (16:20), where we might see Duncan Keith next season (21:00), what to expect from Don Granato in Buffalo (23:50), a new 8-year contract for Ryan Nugent-Hopkins (25:50) and the guys get into some trophy talk to wrap up the podcast (33:00).

item.title: Patiocast | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Elliotte is on a patio and the Stanley Cup final is underway! The guys recap game 1 (00:00) and detail how the Lightning attacked the Canadiens. They also discuss the state of the union address by Gary Bettman and Bill Daly highlighting the sexual assault allegations within the Blackhawks organization in 2010 (9:00) and where the league stands with the Olympics (12:45), the search for a coach in Arizona (17:00), Wayne Simmonds and the Leafs (19:00), if Mark Giordano could be an Oiler next season (22:30), where the Canucks are at with Quinn Hughes and Elias Petersson, and much more.

item.title: The Chicago Blackhawks and the Stanley Cup Final | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A former Chicago Blackhawks player is suing the organization alleging sexual assault during the 2009-10 season. Jeff and Elliotte give their thoughts on the situation (00:00) and try to provide more details from what they have gathered. They also preview the Stanley Cup final between the Canadiens and the Lightning (6:30), wonder how the Islanders will approach their off-season (19:30), discuss a couple of the coaching vacancies, and much more.

item.title: Olé, Olé, Olé, Olé!!!! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Saint-Jean-Baptiste Day, held annually on June 24, is the feast day of St John the Baptist… but today it was also the Montreal Canadiens day to break the fast and feast on the Golden Knights! Jeff and Elliotte discuss Montreal’s big win tonight (1:00) and also speculate about what this could mean for Vegas making moves for next year (12:15). A quick look ahead at what we can expect in Game 7 between the Islanders and Lightning (15:30).

item.title: Endangered Zebras | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description In a hotly contested Stanley Cup Playoffs series, officiating has taken centre stage as Jeff and Elliotte tackle controversial calls – or lack of calls – and tackle the question of what more can be done (6:24). But first, a surprise announcement and celebration spurs talk of hockey-inspired baby names (0:13). The guys then discuss what makes Robin Lehner a standout on and off the ice (20:02), the possibility of an Oliver Ekman-Larsson trade (26:38), some potential coaching moves throughout the NHL (28:57), the process behind various NHL Awards selections (34:53), and finally Jeff and Elliotte answer your #Ask31 questions (38:00).

item.title: Coming Next Season: The 32 Thoughts Arm Wrestling Challenge | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Subconjunctival hemorrhage occurs when a blood vessel breaks just underneath the surface of your eye. David Amber kicks off the podcast by telling Jeff and Elliotte the story of how a blood vessel broke in one of his eyes during his university days. The guys then chat about Carolina signing Rod Brind’Amour to a three-year deal (18:00) the same day he wins the Jack Adams Award, Tampa playing the villain role the last few seasons (12:20), the search for a coach in Seattle (23:45), Jack Eichel and Sam Reinhart possibly on the move (26:30), teams to watch as we approach the Entry & Expansion Drafts (29:30), and how Elliotte evaluates the Jim Gregory General Manager of the Year Award (32:00).

item.title: Islanders Mix Playoff Intensity With Identity | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The third round of the Stanley Cup playoffs is underway! Jeff and Elliotte recap the Islanders-Lightning match-up (9:00) and the Canadiens-Golden Knights series (0:10) to kick off the podcast. They also discuss players who have been given permission to talk to other teams like Dougie Hamilton (19:30), the New York Rangers hiring Gerard Gallant as their new head coach (26:16), and which teams are keeping an eye on Jack Eichel (29:30).

item.title: The Final Four | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The stage is set as Montreal, Tampa Bay, Las Vegas, and the New York Islanders battle it out for the Stanley Cup. Jeff and Elliotte recap the Golden Knights-Avalanche series (00:10), credit Peter DeBoer for the confidence he had in his team after going down two games, and wonder if he gets enough credit for what he’s done in his coaching career. They also breifly look at the off-season for the Avalanche (15:30), what the Bruins planning on doing with Tuukka Rask, Taylor Hall and David Krejci (24:10), why Rod Brind’Amour hasn’t signed with the Hurricanes (19:00), and talk about some of the new faces behind the bench in Columbus (28:40), Calgary (33:10) and Vancouver (31:10).

item.title: Scott O’Neil: CEO of the New Jersey Devils & Philadelphia 76ers | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Scott O’Neil has held a number of executive positions in North American sports. He joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about his new book “Be Where Your Feet Are”, finding stillness in your life, preparing for success as well as failure, the process with the 76ers, how his team is building out initiatives that better reflect their community, and he shares a Lou Lamoriello story from his early days with the NBA.
