item.title: Snake Eyes for the Avalanche | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Quick carcast to start the week! Jeff and Elliotte recap a pair of divisional match-ups (Avalanche-Golden Knights 2:30 & Jets-Habs 7:30) to kick off the podcast, discuss the gold medal victory by Gerard Gallant and Team Canada at the world hockey championship (19:00), the return of Stanley Cup playoff games on both sides of the border for the semifinals as Canadian federal government grants travel exemptions (26:00), the unstoppable Tampa Bay power play and chat about some exciting news from the OHL draft.

item.title: Scheifele Suspension | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Mark Scheifele has been suspended four games for his hit on Jake Evans in game 1 of the Canadiens-Jets series. Jeff and Elliotte break down the wide variety of opinions (00:01) they’ve heard the last 24-hours from around the hockey world regarding the hit, what was said in the phone hearing, and if some players don’t understand how much the game changes during the Stanley Cup playoffs. The guys also discuss officiating in the playoffs (19:00), recap all four divisional series (24:00), question if the conversation between Jack Eichel and the Sabres has changed now that Buffalo holds the first overall pick in the upcoming draft (35:45) and they finish the podcast off with a very open conversation about the situation in Toronto (47:40).

item.title: So You Think You’re Stressed … Here’s Steve Dangle! | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Montreal Canadiens force a game 7 against the Toronto Maple Leafs. Jeff and Elliotte discuss (25:00) the excitement around the game, fans in the stands in Montreal, and which team has the most to lose. Plus, they are joined by Steve Dangle (42:00) to talk about his frustrations, who he thinks is underperforming, and his watch events during every Leafs-Habs game on Sportsnet’s YouTube channel. They also touch on possible outcomes following the match penalty that was handed out to Ryan Reaves on Sunday night (00:01), the high flying scoring machine that is the Colorado Avalanche (2:20), Seth Jones deciding to test free agency (10:00) and PWHPA Secret Dream Gap Tour (1:02:00).

item.title: 31 Lies | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Back by popular demand, it’s the carcast with Jeff riding shotgun! The guys break down game 5 Leafs-Habs and what we could expect as the series heads back to Montreal where we’ll see fans in the stands (3:00). They also wonder if Pittsburgh (10:20) and Florida (24:30) will make any changes this off-season (10:20), preview game 7 Vegas-Minnesota, propose a few landing spots for Jim Rutherford as he finds himself an agent (32:00), discuss the shocking result in the Oilers-Jets series (36:00) and look ahead to Canes-Bolts next round (54:30).

item.title: A Stunning Sunday | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A pair of recent Stanley Cup winners have been eliminated from the playoffs. Jeff and Elliotte break down what went wrong for Washington (6:40) and St. Louis (16:31) and list off some of their top priorities as they go into the off-season. They also discuss the return of Nikolaj Ehlers (0:00) and the Jets going up 3-0 in their series against the Oilers, the killer instinct of the Avalanche (24:00), Hall and the Bruins advancing (15:00), and Nazem Kadri appealing his 8-game suspension (28:15).

item.title: Post-Game Carcast | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description A late night of hockey means Elliotte joins us from the road. The guys discuss the scary incident that sent John Tavares to the hospital, the events that followed, and the type of response we might see from Toronto in game 2 on Saturday night. They also chat about the return of John Davidson to Columbus (18:20), Johnny Gaudreau’s comments at his end-of-season press conference (29:05), a heroic performance by Ryan Lomberg (14:00), and updates from Vancouver (21:50)

item.title: Paul Stastny and Six More, Please | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Paul Stastny recently played his 1000th career NHL game. He joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about (37:30) the milestone, his Hall of Fame father, the evolution of Nikolaj Ehlers, being coached by Paul Maurice, and how to slow down Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl. The guys also recap the first couple days of the Stanley Cup playoffs (00:00), why Zach Parise was a healthy scratch (19:30), Colby Armstrong’s interview with Sidney Crosby (29:10), the performance by Craig Anderson and the Caps (32:25), the situation in Vancouver (59:30) and the unbelievable start to the Florida-Tampa series (01:00).

item.title: Sam the Florida Man | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sam Bennett has 15 points in 10 games with the Florida Panthers. He joins Jeff and Elliotte on the podcast (37:00) to talk about the trade that sent him to Florida, when he felt like his role was diminishing with the Flames, why he’s playing so well with the Panthers, the worldly skills of Alexander Barkov, how he prepares for the playoffs and what it’s like to play for Joel Quenneville.

item.title: Shane Wright: U18 World Champ | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description After winning a gold medal at the U18 World Championships with Team Canada, Shane Wright joins Jeff and Elliotte on the podcast to talk about his experience at the tournament, battling through a few minor illnesses during the tourney and what it means to represent Canada. They also chat about his favourite NHL team, players that impress him, and what he’d like to work on in the off-season.

item.title: The Muller Report | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Kirk Muller played in the NHL for 19 seasons and has been behind the bench since 2011. He joins Jeff and Elliotte on the podcast (42:00) to talk about Montreal’s impressive play in the bubble last season, how to find success as a player in a market like Montreal, his thoughts on Nick Suzuki and Jesperi Kotkaniemi, coaches that had an impact on his career, memories of Rendez-vous ’87, and his interest in finding a coaching job in the NHL.

item.title: Backes to the Future | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description David Backes has played for 3 teams (St. Louis, Boston and Anaheim) during his 15-year NHL career. He joined Jeff and Elliotte on the podcast (52:30) to talk about the celebration that took place on Wednesday night in St. Louis, what it was like to learn from veterans like Bill Guerin, Dallas Drake, Doug Weight and Keith Tkachuk when he joined the league, his rookie dinner, fighting Team Canada players ahead of the 2010 Olympics, being a buffer between the players and Ken Hitchcock, his work with dogs in the St.

item.title: Bob Hartley: A KHL Champion | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description He has won a championship in the NHL, AHL, NLA, QMJHL, and now the KHL. Avangard Omsk head coach, Bob Hartley, joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about winning the Gagarin Cup, how Ilya Kovalchuk has changed since their days together in Atlanta, memories from his time with the Thrashers, if Kovalchuk wants to return to the NHL, coaches that he looked up to over the years, and he gives the guys a scouting report on Blue Jackets 21st overall draft pick, Yegor Chinakhov

item.title: The Brind’Amour Flex | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Rod Brind’Amour is stepping up for his staff in Carolina. Jeff and Elliotte break down (00:10) the contract talks between Canes brass and their head coach, Brind’Amour’s request to see his staff taken care of before he signs his contract and what the market might look like if Brind’Amour was available. They also discuss the Seattle Kraken now that they are officially the 32nd team in the NHL (14:00), teams not in the playoffs that caught the guys by surprise ….

item.title: Nashville’s Roman Empire | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Roman Josi of the Nashville Predators joins the podcast for episode #200! He chats with Jeff and Elliotte (53:00) about the conversations amongst his teammates leading up to the trade deadline, what it’s like playing in front of Pekka Rinne, how meditation has helped him on and off the ice, and what he took away from each of his coaches in Nashville. They then talk about Ryan Miller’s retirement (10:30), the AHL deciding not to hold playoffs except for the Pacific division (18:50), U.

item.title: A First-Class Gesture | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Players from the Toronto Maple Leafs recently extended a helping hand to their AHL teammates. Jeff and Elliotte discuss Jason Spezza’s leadership in wanting to financially help his Marlies teammates and if we could see him in a managerial role in Toronto a few years from now. They also chat about the playoff race in the Scotia North Division between Calgary, Montreal and Vancouver, the pressure on Montreal to make the playoffs, what Marc Bergevin might be feeling at this moment, and much more.

item.title: If You Give Us The Runway | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Vancouver Canucks played their first game in almost a month. Jeff and Elliotte discuss (00:00) what the victory against the Maple Leafs might mean for the team, the leadership of Bo Horvat, what was said in the locker room during the 2nd intermission, and the impressive play of Braden Holtby. Debra Berman, National Stylist at Rogers Communications (Sportsnet & Hockey Night in Canada), joins the podcast (21:20) to talk about how Jeff and Elliotte’s fashion sense has evolved (thanks to her) over the last few years, which broadcasters weren’t willing to change their style, her approach when fitting on-air talent with a wardrobe that makes them feel good, and the important role hair, makeup & wardrobe play in the overall look and feel of a show.

item.title: Trade Deadline Wrap Up | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The NHL Trade Deadline ended with a splash. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the trade between the Red Wings and Capitals (00:00), how it was structured, and why certain players (and picks) were in the mix. They also recap — Taylor Hall to Boston (17:30), the Pens picking up Jeff Carter (28:30), all the action from the Maple Leafs (30:40), the talks between Montreal and Tony DeAngelo, the additions in Florida (42:30), the situation in Vancouver, trade talks around Ryan Getzlaf (50:20) and much more.

item.title: Almost There | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Vancouver Canucks have re-signed Tanner Pearson. Jeff and Elliotte discuss why contract talks suddenly picked up (2:20), where things stand with Quinn Hughes and Elias Pettersson, why the Canucks might have to play out the regular season even if it means playing into the playoffs, and the general mood around the club as players and coaches deal with COVID-19. They also chat about the Florida-Chicago trade (12:50), the cost of a first-round draft pick (14:30), possible suitors for Taylor Hall (19:00), what the Maple Leafs are possibly thinking as the deadline approaches (24:45), and they take some of your #Ask31 questions.

item.title: Who is Buying, Selling, or Staying ft. Chris Johnston | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Vancouver Canucks have 16 players and 3 coaches on the NHLs COVID-19 protocol list. Jeff and Elliotte provide an update on the situation in the Lower Mainland (00:01) and discuss possible outcomes from this including the potential of a playoff bubble and how it might affect the North Division for the remainder of the season. Chris Johnston of Sportsnet joins the guys (10:40) to help preview the upcoming trade deadline.

item.title: Philadelphia Cheesed | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Flyers have some serious decisions to make over the coming months. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the situation in Philadelphia as the team goes through a difficult stretch (00:02), who might be available for the expansion draft, why Shayne Gostisbehere was waived, and how they might approach the trade deadline. They also chat about the recent game postponement between Vancouver-Calgary due to COVID-19 protocol (19:20), the signing of Thatcher Demko (21:30), what Vancouver plans on doing (27:30) with their unsigned players (and coaches), goaltending in Toronto (26:00), what is happening in Nashville (30:00), teams to watch as we approach the deadline (Carolina 35:20 & Florida 38:20), Spencer Knight signing with the Panthers (40:10), a memorable post-game presser from Erik Karlsson (49:30), some of your #Ask31 questions (56:30) and much more.

item.title: Peeling Back the Layers | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Veteran referee Tim Peel “no longer will be working NHL games now or in the future” according to the NHL after his hot mic incident. Jeff and Elliotte discuss how quickly the league made their decision (00:00), if the punishment was too harsh, the impact the incident could have on the league’s business model as it related to gambling, the relationship between players and officials, and what a perfect game for calls looks like to the guys.

item.title: The State of Women’s Hockey | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The National Women’s Hockey League is set to return to play this weekend in Massachusetts to give out the Isobel Cup to one of the four remaining teams. Marisa Ingemi of NBC Sports and Sportsnet joins the podcast to talk about the leagues return to play, the relationship between the NWHL and PWHPA, the NHLs potential future involvement in women’s hockey, the impact Dani Rylan Kearney had on the NWHL, the job Tyler Tumminia has done since joining the league, and she gives us a bit of a preview to what we’re going to see this weekend in Boston.

item.title: News & Notes plus Anton Forsberg’s Amazing Odyssey | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff joined the Hockey Night in Canada crew for his first in-arena game in over 14 months. He tells Elliotte about his experience in Montreal (00:00) and what surprised him most about being back in an NHL rink. They also break down what they’ve heard from around the league including teams to keep an eye on as we approach the trade deadline (15:10), a potential fit for Conor Garland (16:00), what Canadian club might be interested in Mattias Ekholm (23:50), if Ryan Ellis is a piece Nashville would be willing to move (10:30), some literal puck talk (55:00), Elliotte picks a mystery player to replace Anders Lee (32:15), they address the Jonathan Quick to Toronto rumours (31:00) and much more.

item.title: “Crossroads” With Kaleb Dahlgren | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Buffalo Sabres have parted ways with head coach Ralph Krueger. Jeff and Elliotte discuss why the team made the move (00:01), question if Zoom media availabilities add to the negativity around the club, which players are untouchable going into the trade deadline, and if the new coaching staff can help Rasmus Dahlin get out of his slump. They also chat about the lack of goaltending in Ottawa (32:00), explain why Jimmy Vesey wasn’t available for the Canucks on Wednesday night (26:00), debate if coaches are needed on the bench (after watching the Rangers beat up on the Flyers) and take some of your #Ask31 (1:09:00) questions.

item.title: Join Elliotte On His Drive Home | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Following the Maple Leafs-Senators game on Sunday night, Elliotte called Jeff on his way home from the studio to talk some hockey. Here’s their conversation. Some of the topics that were discussed — Joey Daccord’s memorable night in Ottawa (00:00), the struggles in Toronto (7:30), why Nashville will be the team to watch as the trade deadline approaches (12:00), the recent “rebuild” comment by Erik Karlsson (15:00), new life in Calgary under Darryl Sutter (17:45), the red-hot Islanders (19:40), a theory on the secondary rights deal south of the board (30:20) and much more.

item.title: ESPN And The Future Of The NHL | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The NHL has found its (back-to-the-future) broadcast partner in the United States. Jeff and Elliotte discuss why ESPN was the league’s top choice (13:10), what it means for NHL finances and what it’s like when a broadcaster loses its rights. They also break down the Bill Daly and Gary Bettman virtual media conference (2:00), offer an update on the NHL Draft and Lottery (9:40), wonder which teams are sellers and buyers going into the trade deadline (27:10) and much more.

item.title: Tom Wilson And A New Era For Women’s Hockey | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Tom Wilson is suspended seven games for his hit on Brandon Carlo. Jeff and Elliotte break down the decision (00:00) and wonder if the number of games would have been different if Wilson wasn’t involved. They then chat about Jim Benning’s Canucks press conference (13:00), the continued struggles in Buffalo (18:00) and answer some #Ask31 questions (25:00). The guys are also joined by NWHL interim commissioner Tyler Tumminia (36:30) who announces the league’s return, what went wrong in Lake Placid, what types of skills she’s leaned on to get through this difficult period, her openness to working with the PWHPA, what she envisions for the game, growing up around baseball and the types of business conversations she has with her husband, Pittsburgh Pirates GM Ben Cherington.

item.title: Remembering Walter | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte remember Canada’s hockey dad, Walter Gretzky, who passed away late Thursday night at the age of 82. They also touch on Calgary’s coaching change with Darryl Sutter taking charge (12:00), Trent Frederic’s sneaky toughness (29:30), the hiring of Sean Burke in Montreal (21:00), Jarmo Kekalainen’s confidence in John Tortorella (36:00), the Leafs’ sweep of the Oilers (37:10) and much more. Then, Minnesota captain Jared Spurgeon joins the podcast (44:00) to talk about the addition of Kirill Kaprizov, the team’s hot run this season, getting the ‘C’, signing a new contract in the off-season, the Wild’s retro jersey and his junior days in Spokane.

item.title: Sam Gagner: Taking Over the Marlboros with John Tavares | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Detroit Red Wings forward Sam Gagner joins Jeff and Elliotte. They discuss why he and fellow Marlboros alumnus John Tavares wanted to get involved in minor hockey, where he was when Elliotte broke the news on Hockey Night in Canada, if he was surprised by the hockey community’s reaction, the types of changes he’d like to implement within the organization and some of the challenges that await them.

item.title: Best Game Ever Last Week | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description If you didn’t stay up late on Saturday night, you missed an exciting game in San Jose. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the back-and-forth contest between the Blues and Sharks (00:10), Jordan Binnnington’s tantrum and the current state of the St. Louis Blues. They also take your #Ask31 questions throughout the podcast (12:50), talk Nathan MacKinnon (14:20), the new look Wild (16:30), signature moves (22:00), Columbus’s difficult stretch (25:00), NBA (NHL?

item.title: The NHL Draft: What’s Best For The Game | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Canadiens have parted way with head coach Claude Julien and assistant Kirk Muller. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the changes in Montreal (00:00) and what we know about interim head coach Dominique Ducharme. The guys also chat about the 2021 NHL Draft (19:30) and if the date should be moved, an interesting moment from the Kings-Blues game (26:00), the situation in Buffalo (36:25) with Jeff Skinner (28:00) and much more.

item.title: It’s Good That You Hate Canada. Plus: Turtleneck Tales. | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The turtleneck stole the show! Jeff opens the podcast asking Elliotte about his Hockey Night in Canada fashion choice (00:00), the inspiration behind it and the reaction on social media. They also talk hockey — the pair of games in Lake Tahoe (23:00), Sidney Crosby and Travis Zajac playing in their 1000th games (30:30), the L.A.’s impressive run (36:45), Calgary’s tough stretch (41:20), who’s available in Nashville (40:00) and why everyone south of the border hates the North Division (14:40).

item.title: What’s Going On Off The Ice In Arizona? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte discuss Katie Strang’s investigation into the Arizona Coyotes’ alleged business practices and internal workings (00:00) and what they have been hearing. They also touch on Connor McDavid hitting 500 points (18:00), Elliotte’s mystery player (31:20), potential moves in Nashville (35:00), Florida’s strong start (37:00), another PWHPA partnership (42:00) and much more. Then Blake Bolden joins the guys (45:00) to talk about her role as an AHL scout with the L.

item.title: Tavares And Gagner: NHL Players And Minor Hockey Owners | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description John Tavares and Sam Gagner will operate the Toronto Marlboros minor-hockey club. Jeff and Elliotte explain why the pair were interested in the team (00:00), how it will work and why this is good for the Greater Toronto Hockey League. They also discuss the surprising Chicago Blackhawks (19:00), the struggling Predators (23:30), Francesco Aquilini’s tweet supporting his GM and coach (28:40), Brian Burke’s send off on Hockey Night in Canada (32:00) and much more.

item.title: We Texted WWE Superstar Edge… And Here We Are | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Royal Rumble champion, Adam Copeland a.k.a. Edge, joins Jeff and Elliotte to chat about his Toronto Maple Leafs fandom, his memorabilia collection, Sidney Crosby’s golden goal in 2010, falling in love with wrestling, returning from rehab and much more. Music Outro: The Zolas – I Feel The Transition Find more music by The Zolas here This podcast is produced and sound designed by Amil Delic, and hosted by Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman.

item.title: Bye Bye, Burkie | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Brian Burke is joining the Pittsburgh Penguins as their President of Hockey Operations. But before he goes, he joins Jeff and Elliotte to chat about why he decided to get back into an executive position, how the deal came together, what he likes about the organization, the message from ownership and much more. This podcast is produced and sound designed by Amil Delic, and hosted by Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman.

item.title: When You Mess Up, Fess Up And Dress Up | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description An offside controversy clouded Carolina’s win over the Blue Jackets Sunday. Jeff and Elliotte break down the situation (00:00), where the league went wrong and discuss if a rule change is needed. They also examine the struggling Canucks (20:30 & 38:00), McDavid and Draisaitl’s ice time (33:00), the injury to Wayne Simmonds (34:00), the talks around Sam Bennett (29:40), Florida’s first regulation loss of the season (35:30) and much more.

item.title: Our COVID Reality | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The NHL is reacting quickly to its COVID-19 outbreak. Jeff and Elliotte discuss (00:00) how the virus is impacting teams, protocols being implemented to prevent further spread and what the league might do with so many games to make up. They also check in on Pittsburgh’s GM search (20:00) and talk about Tony DeAngelo’s time in New York (24:20), the Rangers hosting a PWHPA game (26:00), the NWHL suspending its season (28:00), Paul Maurice defending his captain (30:45), the struggling Canucks (37:50) and much more.

item.title: Kevin Bieksa On The Road And Tony DeAngelo On Waivers | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description This podcast took two hours to record as the news continued to trickle in. Jeff and Elliotte on what they were hearing throughout Sunday (00:30) as the New York Rangers placed Tony DeAngelo on waivers. They also discuss trade requests from Sam Bennett (10:30) and Victor Mete (13:45), the search for a GM in Pittsburgh (15:45), Lee Stempniak’s new role in Arizona (18:20), and much more. Plus, Kevin Bieksa joins the podcast (25:45) from… Toledo?

item.title: Two Shockers: Jim Rutherford And Tim & Sid | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description After 20 years of entertaining listeners and viewers, Tim & Sid is changing — Sid is moving on. Jeff and Elliotte are joined by Tim Micallef and Sid Seixeiro (19:00) to talk about their long-time friendship and work together. Dating back to their days as interns at Headline Sports, then cutting their chops at TheScore with Elliotte, and on to Sportsnet 590 The FAN and Sportsnet TV, it’s been a special partnership.

item.title: Jarmo Kekalainen on the Dubois-Laine Deal | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Columbus Blue Jackets GM Jarmo Kekalainen joins Jeff and Elliotte (11:50) to discuss how and when the trade with the Winnipeg Jets came together, why Jack Roslovic was an important piece, the possible misconception about Columbus as an organization and community, and how the club tried to move up in the 2016 draft to select Patrik Laine. The guys also talk about Vancouver’s struggles (51:00), Brent Burns’ silky mitts (54:00), youthful flair in New Jersey (57:45), ideas around the draft (1:07:10), the NHL suspending John Chayka (1:00:30) and much more.

item.title: What Now For Pierre-Luc Dubois? | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Correction: The voice at the start of the podcast is Jody Shelley not John Forslund. Our apologies. Pierre-Luc Dubois played five shifts for a total of 3:55 during Columbus’s overtime loss to Tampa Bay Thursday night. Following the game, Jeff and Elliotte take a stab at figuring out the complex situation (00:00) between the Blue Jackets and Dubois. Then they discuss the details around Washington’s six-figure fine for violating COVID-19 protocols (13:00), the league’s plans if a team can’t finish the season and how cancelling games could impact players’ pensions.

item.title: Keith Yandle Scored While We Were Recording | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Hockey is back and so is the drama. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the situation in Florida between Keith Yandle and the Panthers (00:00), if Pierre-Luc Dubois will be a Blue Jacket by season’s end (16:30), Jakub Voracek’s post-game comments on Friday (27:30), the impressive Minnesota Wild (49:30) and much more. Music Outro: Ten Kills the Pack – Body You can find more music from Ten Kills the Pack here

item.title: 31 Season Previews | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The NHL season starts today and Jeff and Elliotte preview it with a thought on each team, a couple things they’ll be keeping their eyes on, Stanley Cup predictions and much more. East Division (00:00) Central Division (27:00) West Division (53:30) North Division (1:14:30) Music Outro: Scenic Route to Alaska – Call Your Friends We also featured “Polarized” by Scenic Route to Alaska during our last segment You can find their latest “Time for Yourself” here

item.title: The NHL Adapts On The Fly, Plus Jordan Subban: Hockey Player And Amplifying Entrepreneur | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Some NHL training camps aren’t off to a good start thanks to COVID — the Stars are dealing with an outbreak in their organization and the Blue Jackets have cancelled practice “out of an abundance of caution and in accordance with NHL Covid-19 protocols.” Jeff and Elliotte discuss how the league will handle the positive cases, if we’ll see a bubble scenario again and what other teams are thinking.

item.title: Reporting to Training Camp | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte kick off 2021 with a conversation about how some organizations accept losing, what it takes to create a winning culture and how, sometimes, you have to lose to win. They also discuss what the North Division could mean for the NHL from a revenue standpoint, expectations for a pair of Canadian teams, Pierre-Luc Dubois signing an extension, Zdeno Chara finding a new home and much more.

item.title: Welcome To Our Holiday Party | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description As 2020 comes to a close (thank goodness), Jeff and Elliotte host their first 31 Thoughts holiday party with friends from the Sportsnet hockey department. David Amber on his 15-year-old skates, an update on hunting season from Louie DeBrusk, Tara Slone reminisces about a sauna experience in Thunder Bay, Christine Simpson shares a story about her brother Craig, Caroline Cameron plays us a song, Kelly Hrudey talks about his caroling days, Anthony Stewart explains why his sister’s lasagna is better than your lasagna, Ryan Leslie tells us about a memorable flight home from L.

item.title: Let’s Make A Deal : The NHL And (Our Interview Guest) Anthony Duclair | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Mark your calendars! The NHL season begins January 13 with a 56-game regular season that concludes May 8. Jeff and Elliotte discuss all the details, including unlimited goalies at training camp, possible locations for teams and more. The guys also chat with newly signed Florida Panther Anthony Duclair about why he chose not to have an agent, what he took away from the experience and why Florida was the right fit before he reminisces about his days with the Quebec Remparts under Patrick Roy.

item.title: Tyler Seguin: All Business | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Tyler Seguin has had a busy off-season rehabbing a torn labrum in Dallas. But while on the couch, he’s found time to build out his lifestyle brand, NINE ONE and do a photo shoot for his new favourite fragrance. Seguin joins the guys to discuss why he’s decided to focus on off-ice business interests, how his rehab is progressing, share a few stories from the Edmonton bubble and more.

item.title: The NHL Inches Closer To A Return | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The league and the NHLPA are getting their pucks in a row for a return. Jeff and Elliotte discuss the long-term effects of the CBA, possible target dates, division realignment and ads on helmets. They are also joined by newly hired Florida Panthers goaltending consultant François Allaire, who talks about his role, how it came about, the biggest changes between the pipes in the past decade, working with Patrick Roy and J-S Giguère, and the perfect height (if there is one) for a goaltender.

item.title: Rick Vaive: On Hockey And Life | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description “Catch 22: My Battles, in Hockey and in Life” is a new book by Rick Vaive with Scott Morrison. Rick joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about his new book, the Birmingham Bulls, playing with Bill Derlago, being the first Leaf to score 50 goals, Harold Ballard as an owner, coaches he enjoyed playing for, Börje Salming off the ice, and much more. Music Outro: Hiroshi Sato – Say Goodbye

item.title: What We Could See During The 2021 Season That We’ve Never Seen Before | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte offer some updates on the NHL’s return, where the owners stand at the moment, salary deferrals and possible tweaks to the 2021 season like taxi squads, ads on jerseys, expanded playoffs and a shortened training camp/pre-season. RIP Fred Sasakamoose This podcast is produced and sound designed by Amil Delic, and hosted by Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman. Audio Credits: New York Islanders The views and opinions expressed in this podcast are those of the hosts and guests and do not necessarily reflect the position of Rogers Media Inc.

item.title: Mark Guy: From The Hockey Industry To The Auto Industry | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Mark Guy has been an NHL agent with Newport Sports Management for more than 20 years. He’s represented big names like Steven Stamkos, Alex Pieterangelo, Bo Horvat, Travis Konecny, Tom Wilson, and the Subban and Strome brothers. But now he’s getting out. Mark joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about why he decided to leave the business, who he’ll miss working with, the biggest changes he’s seen in the industry and some of his more memorable negotiations.

item.title: Quick Check In | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Talks around the 2021 NHL season are heating up. Jeff and Elliotte break down what they’ve heard regarding start and end dates, fans in the stands, sponsorship and the negotiation between the league and its players. This episode is dedicated to the late Erin Paul. Our condolences to her family and friends. This podcast is produced and sound designed by Amil Delic, and hosted by Jeff Marek and Elliotte Friedman.

item.title: Stan Bowman: A Change In Approach, Not A Change In Direction | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Chicago Blackhawks GM joins Jeff and Elliotte for a wide-ranging discussion. They talk about being transparent with the fanbase, building from within rather than through free agency, playing youth over veterans, how management approached the Jonathan Toews comments, the challenges he faces as a GM during the pandemic and much more. Letter to their fans: https://www.sportsnet.ca/nhl/article/blackhawks-publish-letter-fans-confirming-team-rebuilding/ Music Outro: Sam Roberts Band – I Like the Way You Talk About the Future

item.title: Adam Oates: Get The Toys Off The Ice | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description The Hockey Hall of Famer and skills coach joins Jeff and Elliotte to talk about the types of drills that frustrate him and what coaches should focus on when designing practices before offering some creative pointers. They also discuss coaching during the pandemic, some of the challenges around travel and the approach he has when working with professionals versus youth players. Music Outro: Satellite & the Harpoonist – Ballet in a Phone Booth

item.title: Jamie Bozzo: Managing Players’ Careers | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Sports Professional Management Inc. represents some big names in hockey, including William Nylander, Johnny Gaudreau, Torey Krug and Brandon Saad, and has a total value of active contracts that exceeds $222 million. Jamie Bozzo handles client relationships for SPM, dealing with players and their families on all kinds of specialized scenarios. She joins Jeff and Elliotte for a wide-ranging discussion about prepping clients for free agency, working with players and organizations around trades, financial advice and much more, including detailing the work put in on Nylander’s down-to-the-wire extension with the Maple Leafs in late 2018.

item.title: There Was Alcohol Involved | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description After the longest NHL season ever, a few drinks are deserved all around as Jeff and Elliotte run down the past week in the NHL. Vegas landed the biggest free-agency fish in Alex Pietrangelo (00:01), to the displeasure of some Golden Knights players and their agents. The Canucks added Nate Schmidt (28:30), but only after they lost some key contributors. Taylor Hall bet on himself in Buffalo (19:00), Torey Krug took his talents to St.

item.title: Emptying Out The Notebook | 32 Thoughts: The Podcast
item.description: Podcast Description Jeff and Elliotte look at all 31 teams and discuss what their goals should be for the off-season (Atlantic – 34:15; Metropolitan – 47:30; Central – 1:05:30; Pacific – 1:17:45). But before doing that, they kick things off with a Word Association built specifically to challenge Elliotte, discuss Tampa’s tough road to the Stanley Cup (21:00) and how a flat cap will impact player salaries next season (31:00).
